description: This system takes the processed analysis results and transforms them into various human-readable documentation formats, including HTML, Markdown, MDX, and reStructuredText, incorporating diagrams and structured insights. It acts as the overarching engine for generating all forms of documentation from the analysis data.

components.name: Analysis Data Models
components.description: Defines the standardized data structures for representing the output of the code analysis phase, including insights, components, relationships, and source code references. It acts as the initial structured input for the documentation generation process.

components.name: Analysis JSON Converter
components.description: Transforms the generic analysis data from the `Analysis Data Models` into a structured JSON format, specifically optimized for generating diagrams (e.g., Cytoscape, Mermaid).

components.name: HTML Output Generator
components.description: Generates comprehensive and interactive HTML documentation, often incorporating visual diagrams, from the processed analysis data. It orchestrates the creation of web-based documentation.

components.name: MDX Output Generator
components.description: Produces documentation in MDX format, allowing for embedded components and dynamic content, typically including Mermaid diagrams.

components.name: Sphinx RST Output Generator
components.description: Creates reStructuredText (RST) files, which are the foundation for Sphinx-based documentation, with support for embedded diagrams.

components.name: Markdown Output Generator
components.description: Generates standard Markdown documentation, suitable for various platforms, and includes embedded Mermaid diagrams.

components.name: HTML Template Populator
components.description: A specialized utility that takes generated content and data to populate predefined HTML templates, used by the `HTML Output Generator`.

components.name: Output Utilities
components.description: Provides common utility functions for output generation, such as sanitizing strings for file names or identifiers, used across various output generators.
